steps.102: slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
steps.104: Clean-Clean the knife by wiping with a paper towel
steps.105: Cross-Cross the floss's two ends over the tortilla roll's top
steps.106: Slide-Slide floss under the tortilla, perpendicular to the length of the roll
steps.107: Spread-Spread jelly over the nut butter
steps.108: pull-pull the floss ends in opposite directions to slice
steps.109: Place-Place the pinwheels on a plate
steps.110: Secure-Secure the rolled tortilla by inserting 5 toothpicks about 1 inch apart
steps.111: scoop-Use the knife to scoop jelly from the jar
steps.112: Spread-Spread nut butter onto the tortilla, leaving 1/2-inch uncovered at the edges
steps.113: scoop-Use a butter knife to scoop nut butter from the jar
steps.114: Trim-Trim the ends of the tortilla roll with the butter knife, leaving 1/2 inch margin between the last toothpick and the end of the roll
steps.115: Place-Place 8-inch flour tortilla on cutting board
steps.116: Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to the other into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps, but not so tight that the filling leaks
steps.117: Place-Place the floss halfway between toothpicks
steps.118: Clean-Clean the knife by wiping it with a paper towel
